column4: Can anyone help me mount my harddisk that doesn't want to mount anymore with the livecd?
ubuntu wont boot or trying to recover files?
both, at this point
if ext based fs have u tried sudo e2fsck -C0 -p -f -v /dev/sda1
assuming its /dev/sda1
it says it's being opened by another program when i enter that
and it's /dev/sdb1 because it's changed from a to b for some reason even though i have only one harddisk
u can find what it is by doing sudo fdisk -l
nothing happens when i do that
your in the live cd running a terminal?
yep
oh i didnt notice- you know its sb1
if so just change command i gave accordingly
ps- if you forgot the sudo the fdisk -l command will not display anything
i did, this was the output: e2fsck: Device or resource busy while trying to open /dev/sdb1
hmm.
http://pastebin.com/kbLKpKKe
well you tried to mount it and it gave error i think u said so have u restarted since then
yes, still the same
i mean restart and run the e2fsck command without trying to mount it first
to be clear i think its hungup on the last time you tried to mount and that why giving u busy msg when trying to repair
brb
k
